title.bibl: Scrapbook of the Harmonien Singing Society. [Prominent Members of Harmonien]

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

div.bibl: Scrapbook, of the Harmonien Singing Society. [PROMINENT MEMBERS OF HARMONIEN]

body.p: Harmonien has had many prominent members--Senator Niels Juul, for example, and Max Henius, the well-known chemist. Dr. Henius joined the Society in 1901 and was a member until his death, in 1935. He was very active when the singers went on their two tours to Denmark.

Another prominent member was Postmaster C. P. Ditlefsen, who became a member in 1902. He was president of Harmonien for many years, and became well known for his wit and his excellence as a toastmaster.
